qas.question: Who commanded the defense of the Estonia to surrender?
Who disarmed the Estonian Defence Forces?
What was the name of the single unit that didn't surrender?
When did the Estonian Independent Signal Battalion face off against the Soviets?

context: Most of the Estonian Defence Forces surrendered according to the orders of <a0_0>the Estonian government<a0_0/>, believing that resistance was useless and were disarmed by <a1_0>the Red Army<a1_0/>. Only <a2_0>the Estonian Independent Signal Battalion<a2_0/> showed resistance to Red Army and Communist militia "People's Self-Defence" units in front of the XXI Grammar School in Tallinn on <a3_0>21 June<a3_0/>. As the Red Army brought in additional reinforcements supported by six armoured fighting vehicles, the battle lasted several hours until sundown. Finally the military resistance was ended with negotiations and the Independent Signal Battalion surrendered and was disarmed. There were two dead Estonian servicemen, Aleksei Männikus and Johannes Mandre, and several wounded on the Estonian side and about ten killed and more wounded on the Soviet side.
